personal_information_definition: First name or initial + last name combined with: SSN, driver's license number, California ID card number, tax ID number, passport number, military ID number, or other unique government-issued ID number

First name or initial + last name combined with: financial account number, credit or debit card number (with required access code), medical information, health insurance information, unique biometric data generated from measurements of biological characteristics
Username or email address combined with password or security question and answer that would permit access to an online account
breach_definition: Unauthorized acquisition of computerized data that compromises the security, confidentiality, or integrity of personal information maintained by the person or business
encryption_safe_harbor_details: No notification required if data was encrypted and the encryption key was not acquired by an unauthorized person. Good faith acquisition by employee or agent is not a breach if used for lawful purpose.
notification_timeline: In the most expedient time possible and without unreasonable delay

other_agencies: If health data: California Department of Public Health

notification_content_requirements: Name and contact information of the notifying entity
List of types of personal information that were or are reasonably believed to have been compromised
Date of the breach, estimated date, or date range
Whether notification was delayed due to a law enforcement investigation
General description of the breach incident
Toll-free telephone numbers, addresses, and websites of the major credit reporting agencies (if applicable)
If breach involved credentials: advise changing password and security question/answer, or take other appropriate steps
penalties: Civil penalties up to $7,500 per violation under CCPA. AG enforcement. Private right of action for certain data breaches involving non-encrypted/non-redacted personal information under CCPA (Cal. Civ. Code 1798.150) with statutory damages of $100-$750 per consumer per incident.
special_provisions: CCPA (Cal. Civ. Code 1798.150) provides additional private right of action for data breaches involving non-encrypted/non-redacted personal information
Must offer identity theft prevention and mitigation services for at least 12 months if SSN or driver's license number is compromised
Substitute notice allowed if cost exceeds $250,000, or affected class exceeds 500,000 persons, or entity does not have sufficient contact information
Notification must be written in plain language and titled 'Notice of Data Breach'
Must use specific format prescribed by statute (heading, body content order)
